file_content.text: Good to see you again. Master Till'in sent word that he got my holo. Thanks for delivering it.
Thanks for taking my holo to Master Till'in. Good luck on your trials.
Wow--you're those Padawans my instructors keep talking about. They say you're the best students to come here in ages.
Hello there. Congratulations, Jedi. Must feel good to be done with your trials.
Master Orgus's new apprentice--wow. Everyone says you're great with a vibroblade.
You're Master Yuon's apprentice, right? I've heard how strong you are in the Force.
I'm Fia--er, Padawan Fia. Still have to get used to having a title.
I've just started learning about the Force. I've got a long way to go before I'm as good as you.
You seem a little old to begin the training.
You're a beginner?
Until a few days ago, I didn't even know I could use the Force.
Concentrate on your training and you'll do fine.
Just focus on learning.
Hard to concentrate when you're always pinching yourself to check if this is a dream.
Stay open to possibilities, Padawan. You might surprise yourself.
Give yourself more credit.
I've certainly had plenty of surprises lately.
How true.
I thought Jedi were supposed to be humble. Or maybe that's only for beginners like me.
I still can't believe I'm here. Just last week, I was crewing a garbage scow on Raxus Prime.
Then this scary-looking Jedi shows up out of nowhere and says that he can sense the Force in me. What are the odds?
Jedi aren't normally known for their intimidating appearance.
Scary-looking?
Kel Dor just looks so dangerous. I'd never seen anything like him before--er, not that I have a problem with aliens.
He's Kel Dor. As aliens go, they're pretty fierce-looking. I thought he was going to eat me, at first.
There's no such thing as luck, Padawan. You're meant to be here.
Pretty good, actually.
That's exactly what the Jedi who found me said.
You're a real chatterbox.
Am I babbling? I am. Sorry, I do silly things when I get nervous.
Say, do you know Master Till'in? He's the one who discovered me. I'm trying to get a message to him.
He's at the ruins of Kaleth, but the instructors won't let me leave the temple to go see him. They say it's too dangerous.
Why do you need to see him so badly?
What's so important?
Uh, well, it's complicated. I never really thanked him for bringing me to Tython.
I've been to those ruins, and they're deadly.
It's true.
Then you probably saw Master Till'in. He's studying a mystery there about the ancient droids going berserk.
Are these ruins here on Tython?
Ruins of Kaleth?
You haven't been there yet? Kaleth's an ancient Tythonian ruin. Supposed to be pretty exciting.
Why tell me?
I don't mean to bother you. I just want him to know I appreciate everything he's done for me.
Master Till'in is studying a big mystery in Kaleth's ruins. Something about ancient droids attacking people?
If you're headed to the ruins, would you give him this holorecording from me? I'd be so grateful.
Consider it handled, Fia.
Terrific! I can see why everybody here is so impressed with you.
I have many obligations.
Anytime you're in the neighborhood is fine.
Sorry, but no.
Wait, I don't expect you to do it for nothing. I'm good with gadgets. I'll build you something useful.
A gadget will do fine.
Terrific. I'll get to work on it right away and send it to you soon.
Give me something I can spend.
Really? I thought Jedi didn't care about money. Sure, I'll access my account and send you a few credits.
Here's the holorecording. Master Till'in has a small camp outside the ruins of Kaleth. Thanks for doing this.
Stop talking. [Refuse quest]
Oh. Well, all right. Guess I'll ask someone else.
I'm practicing my meditation. Hard to do in a busy area like this.
Hi there. Don't see many non-Jedi at the temple.
